alert.note: Alert for Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 10 at 1:20AM MST until January 10 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet in the Tetons, 10 to 18 inches in the Salt River and Wyoming Ranges, and 6 to 12 inches in the the Gros Ventre. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph through this afternoon. * WHERE...Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains and Salt River and Wyoming Ranges. * WHEN...Through 11 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult over Teton Pass, Togwotee Pass, and Salt River Pass, as well as in the backcountry. Blowing and drifting snow may significantly reduce visibility. Cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes, this morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains
